caseName: Ahmed v. Houk
cause: 28:2254 Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus (State)

recap_documents.description: REPORT AND RECOMMENDATIONS - The Court has considered each of Ahmed's twenty-seven grounds for relief and found none of them, nor any combination of them, meritorious. Accordingly, it is recommended that Ahmed's petition for a writ of habea s corpus be DENIED. Because reasonable jurists would not disagree with this conclusion, Petitioner should be denied a certificate of appealability and the Court should certify to the Sixth Circuit that any appeal would be objectively frivolous. Objections to R&R due by  7/3/2014.  Signed by Magistrate Judge Michael R Merz on 6/16/2014. (kpf1)
